subject: URGENT: Your PayPal Account Has Been Limited
body:
Dear PayPal User,

We have detected suspicious activity on your account. Your account has been temporarily limited for your security.

To restore full access, please verify your identity immediately by clicking the link below:

http://paypal-secure-verify.tk/restore

Failure to verify within 24 hours will result in permanent account closure.

Thank you,
PayPal Security Team

phishing_indicators: Suspicious domain with uppercase 'I' instead of lowercase 'l' (paypaI vs paypal)
Generic greeting 'Dear PayPal User' instead of actual name
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Perfect example from dialogue training - demonstrates paypaI.com vs paypal.com domain spoofing and generic greetings instead of personalized names.
red_flags: Domain spoofing: paypaI-verification.com (uppercase I instead of l)
External suspicious domain for account verification
Generic customer greetings instead of your name
Urgent time-based threats
Requests to click suspicious links for account access
verification_tips: Always check for exact spelling of official domains
PayPal will never use .tk or similar domains for verification
Legitimate emails address you by your registered name
Never click suspicious links - login directly to PayPal instead

subject: Your Amazon Order #AMZ-7829483 Requires Payment Update
body:
Hello,

Your recent Amazon order could not be processed due to payment issues.

Order Details:
- Order #: AMZ-7829483
- Item: iPhone 15 Pro Max
- Amount: $1,199.99

Please update your payment information to avoid order cancellation:
https://amazon-payment-update.org/secure

Regards,
Amazon Customer Service

phishing_indicators: Fake high-value order to create urgency
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Shows how attackers use fake high-value orders and pressure tactics combined with domain spoofing to steal payment information.
red_flags: Wrong domain: amazon-security.net instead of amazon.com
Suspicious payment update domain (.org instead of official Amazon)
Generic greeting instead of your actual name
Unexpected high-value order you didn't make
External links for payment sensitive operations
verification_tips: Amazon only sends order emails from @amazon.com
Check your actual Amazon account for this order number
Never update payment info through email links
Amazon addresses customers by their registered name

subject: Microsoft Windows Security Alert - Virus Detected
body:
SECURITY ALERT

Our systems have detected multiple viruses on your computer.

Immediately download our security scan tool to remove threats:

Download: http://windows-security-fix.com/scanner.exe

Warning: Your files may be permanently damaged if not addressed within 2 hours.

Microsoft Security Team
Toll-Free Support: 1-800-123-FAKE

ai_analysis.educational_focus: Demonstrates tech support scam tactics using fear, fake security alerts, and malware distribution through executable downloads.
red_flags: Wrong domain: microsoft-security.org vs official microsoft.com
Requests to download .exe files from external sites
Extreme urgency tactics (2-hour deadline)
Microsoft doesn't send virus alerts via email
Suspicious phone numbers for 'support'
verification_tips: Microsoft never sends virus detection emails
Never download .exe files from email links
Official Microsoft emails come from microsoft.com domain
Use official antivirus software, not email downloads

subject: Suspicious Login Attempt - Immediate Action Required
body:
Dear Chase Customer,

We detected a login attempt from an unrecognized device:

Location: Nigeria
IP Address: 197.89.123.456
Time: March 18, 2024 3:45 AM

If this was not you, secure your account immediately:
https://chase-secure-login.net/verify

Your account will be locked in 30 minutes if no action is taken.

Chase Bank Security

ai_analysis.educational_focus: Shows banking security phishing using geographic fears, fake login alerts, and urgent time pressure to steal banking credentials.
red_flags: Wrong domain: chase-alert.com instead of official chase.com
Uses geographic stereotypes to create fear
Invalid IP address format (should not end in .456)
External domain for banking security operations
Extreme urgency with 30-minute threat
verification_tips: Chase bank emails come from chase.com domain only
Login directly to Chase website to check alerts
IP addresses don't end in numbers over 255
Banks don't lock accounts with 30-minute email warnings

subject: Your Facebook Account Will Be Deleted Tomorrow
body:
Hello Facebook User,

Due to new privacy regulations, inactive accounts will be permanently deleted.

Your account has been marked for deletion on March 20, 2024.

To keep your account and all your photos/memories, verify your identity:

https://facebook-account-verification.tk/confirm

This process must be completed within 24 hours.

Facebook Team

phishing_indicators: Generic greeting instead of your actual name
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Demonstrates emotional manipulation phishing using fear of data loss and personal memories to bypass logical thinking.
red_flags: Wrong domain: facebook-security.net vs official facebook.com
Generic greeting 'Facebook User' instead of your name
Emotional manipulation about losing personal data
Suspicious .tk domain for account verification
Fake privacy regulation claims
verification_tips: Facebook emails come from facebook.com or facebookmail.com
Facebook addresses users by their registered names
Never use .tk domains for account verification
Check Facebook directly for account status notifications

subject: Netflix Payment Failed - Service Suspended
body:
Hi there,

Your Netflix subscription payment was declined by your bank.

Your account has been temporarily suspended. To restore service:

1. Update your payment method
2. Confirm your billing information

Restore Service: https://netflix-billing.net/update

Note: Failure to update within 48 hours will result in account cancellation.

Netflix Billing Team

phishing_indicators: Domain spoofing with capital 'I' instead of lowercase 'l' (netfIix vs netflix)
Generic greeting instead of account holder name
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Another example of character substitution domain spoofing, similar to PayPal example in dialogue.
red_flags: Domain spoofing: netfIix-support.org (uppercase I instead of lowercase l)
Generic greeting 'Hi there' instead of your name
External .net domain for Netflix billing operations
Urgent payment deadline pressure
Suspicious billing domains
verification_tips: Netflix emails come from netflix.com domain only
Check your actual Netflix account for payment issues
Never update payment info through email links
Netflix addresses subscribers by their registered names

subject: Apple ID Locked Due to Suspicious Activity
body:
Dear Apple Customer,

Your Apple ID has been locked due to multiple failed login attempts from an unknown device.

Device Information:
- iPhone 13 Pro
- Location: Moscow, Russia
- Date: March 21, 2024

Unlock your Apple ID now:
https://appleid-security-unlock.com/restore

Important: Your account will be permanently disabled if not verified within 12 hours.

Apple Security

ai_analysis.educational_focus: Shows Apple ID phishing using device security alerts and geographic scare tactics.
red_flags: Wrong domain: apple-id-verification.com vs official apple.com
Generic greeting instead of your actual name
External domain for Apple ID security operations
Geographic fear tactics
Extreme urgency with 12-hour threat
verification_tips: Apple emails come from apple.com or icloud.com domains only
Check your Apple ID account directly for security alerts
Apple addresses customers by their registered names
Never unlock accounts through external domains

body:

phishing_indicators: Domain spoofing with uppercase 'I' (googIe vs google)
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Demonstrates Google account phishing using blocked sign-in alerts and compromise fears.
red_flags: Domain spoofing: googIe-security-alert.net (uppercase I instead of lowercase l)
External domain for Google account operations
Generic greeting instead of your name
Geographic fear tactics
Non-Google domains for security
verification_tips: Google emails come from google.com or gmail.com domains only
Check Google account security page directly
Google addresses users by their registered names
Never use external sites for Google account recovery

subject: eBay Dispute: Customer Claims Item Not Received
body:
Dear eBay Seller,

A buyer has opened a dispute claiming they never received item #394857291.

Dispute Amount: $1,247.50

Item: MacBook Pro 16-inch

You must respond within 48 hours or funds will be automatically refunded to buyer.

Respond to Dispute: https://ebay-seller-center.net/dispute

eBay Customer Service

phishing_indicators: High-value fake dispute to create panic
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Shows eBay seller phishing using fake disputes and financial pressure tactics.
red_flags: Wrong domain: ebay-resolution.com instead of official ebay.com
High-value dispute you likely didn't have
External domain for eBay seller operations
Generic greeting instead of your seller name
Suspicious seller center domains
verification_tips: eBay emails come from ebay.com domain only
Check your eBay seller dashboard for actual disputes
Verify high-value transactions in your sales history
Never handle disputes through external websites

subject: FRAUD ALERT: Unauthorized Transaction Detected
body:
URGENT FRAUD ALERT

We have detected a suspicious transaction on your Visa card:

Transaction Details:
- Amount: $2,899.00
- Merchant: Bitcoin Exchange
- Location: Romania
- Date: March 24, 2024

If you did not authorize this transaction, immediately secure your card:

https://visa-fraud-protection.net/secure

WARNING: Additional unauthorized charges may occur if not addressed within 1 hour.

Visa Fraud Protection

phishing_indicators: High-value cryptocurrency transaction to create fear
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Demonstrates credit card fraud phishing using cryptocurrency and foreign transaction fears.
red_flags: Wrong domain: visa-security.org vs official visa.com
External domain for Visa security operations
Cryptocurrency transaction scare tactics
Geographic fear tactics
Extreme urgency tactics
verification_tips: Visa communications come from official visa.com domain
Check your actual bank/card issuer for fraud alerts
Call the number on your card for fraud concerns
Banks don't use 1-hour email deadlines for fraud

subject: Limited Time: 300% Bitcoin Investment Returns
body:
Congratulations!

You've been selected for our exclusive Bitcoin investment program.

Investment Details:
- Minimum Investment: $500
- Guaranteed Return: 300% in 30 days
- Risk Level: ZERO
- Spots Available: Only 50 remaining

Start earning today:
https://crypto-profit-max.com/invest

This offer expires in 24 hours. Don't miss out on guaranteed profits!

Crypto Investment Team

phishing_indicators: Claims of 'guaranteed' profits with zero risk
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Shows cryptocurrency investment scam using unrealistic return promises and urgency.
red_flags: Unrealistic investment returns (300% in 30 days)
Claims of zero risk with guaranteed profits
Generic 'Congratulations' without explanation
Limited time offers with artificial scarcity
Cryptocurrency get-rich-quick schemes
verification_tips: No legitimate investment guarantees 300% returns
All investments carry risk - 'zero risk' is a red flag
Research any investment platform thoroughly
Be extremely wary of unsolicited investment offers

subject: FedEx Package Delivery Failed - Action Required
body:
Dear Customer,

Your FedEx package delivery failed due to an incorrect address.

Package Information:
- Tracking: FX-9847562301
- From: Apple Store
- Contents: iPhone 15 Pro
- Value: $1,199

To reschedule delivery and confirm your address:
https://fedex-redelivery.org/schedule

Package will be returned to sender if not rescheduled within 72 hours.

FedEx Customer Service

phishing_indicators: High-value fake package to create urgency
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Demonstrates shipping scam using fake delivery failures and valuable package claims.
red_flags: Wrong domain: fedex-delivery.net vs official fedex.com
High-value package you didn't order
External domain for FedEx operations
Generic greeting instead of recipient name
Suspicious tracking number formats
verification_tips: FedEx emails come from fedex.com domain only
Track packages directly on fedex.com website
Verify you're expecting a package from Apple
Check tracking numbers on official FedEx site

subject: WhatsApp Account Verification Required
body:
Hello WhatsApp User,

Due to new security policies, all accounts must be verified to continue using WhatsApp.

Verification Code: WA-Ver-8829341

Verify your account to avoid suspension:
https://whatsapp-verify.tk/confirm?code=WA-Ver-8829341

Unverified accounts will be deleted after 48 hours.

WhatsApp Security Team

Note: This is an automated message. Do not reply.

ai_analysis.educational_focus: Shows messaging app phishing using fake security policy changes and verification requirements.
red_flags: Wrong domain: whatsapp-verification.com vs official whatsapp.com
Generic greeting instead of your phone number
External .tk domain for WhatsApp verification
Fake verification codes in email
Fake security policy changes
verification_tips: WhatsApp verification happens within the app, not email
WhatsApp doesn't send verification codes via email
Check WhatsApp official channels for policy changes
WhatsApp uses whatsapp.com for official communications

subject: IRS Tax Refund: $3,247.89 Ready for Deposit
body:
Dear Taxpayer,

Good news! You are eligible for a tax refund of $3,247.89.

Refund Processing ID: IRS-REF-2024-7829

To receive your refund quickly, please verify your banking information:

https://irs-refund-portal.net/claim

You must claim your refund within 30 days or it will be forfeited to the US Treasury.

Internal Revenue Service
Tax Refund Department

ai_analysis.educational_focus: Demonstrates tax refund scam using government impersonation and financial incentives.
red_flags: Wrong domain: irs-treasury.org vs official irs.gov
Unexpected tax refund notification
External domain for IRS refund operations
Generic greeting 'Dear Taxpayer'
Generic government greetings
verification_tips: IRS uses irs.gov domain for official communications
Check your tax return status directly on irs.gov
IRS doesn't initiate contact via email for refunds
Be suspicious of unexpected refund notifications

subject: Instagram Verification Badge Available
body:

Account: @your_username

Instagram Verification Team

red_flags: Wrong domain: instagram-heIp.org (uppercase I instead of lowercase l)
Unexpected verification badge approval
External domain for Instagram verification
Generic follower counts
Time pressure for verification
verification_tips: Instagram verification happens within the app
Instagram uses instagram.com for official emails
Check Instagram's official verification process
Be wary of unsolicited verification offers

External domain for Spotify billing
24-hour downgrade threat
Suspicious billing domains

Spotify addresses subscribers by their names

subject: Zoom Meeting Security Update Required
body:
Dear Zoom User,

Due to recent security vulnerabilities, all Zoom accounts must install a critical security update.

Security Update Details:

- Release Date: April 1, 2024
- Priority: CRITICAL

Download the security update:
https://zoom-security-update.com/download

Warning: Accounts without this update will be suspended after April 3, 2024.

Zoom Security Team

phishing_indicators: Requests to download security updates via email
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Shows software update scam using fake security alerts to distribute malware.
red_flags: Wrong domain: zoom-security.org vs official zoom.us
Generic greeting instead of your account name
External domain for Zoom security downloads
Email requests to download software updates
Fake security patch version numbers
verification_tips: Zoom uses zoom.us domain for official communications

subject: CONGRATULATIONS! You've Won $750,000 USD
body:
CONGRATULATIONS!!!

You have won the International Email Lottery!

Winning Details:
- Prize Amount: $750,000 USD
- Ticket Number: INT-2024-7829
- Draw Date: April 1, 2024
- Winning Numbers: 7, 14, 23, 31, 42, 49

To claim your prize, contact our claims agent:
Email: claims@lottery-winners.net
Phone: +44-700-123-4567

You must claim within 14 days or forfeit your winnings.

International Lottery Commission

phishing_indicators: Large prize amount to create excitement
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Classic lottery scam using large prize amounts and fake international organizations.
red_flags: Unexpected lottery win without entering
Large prize amount ($750,000)
Generic 'International Lottery Commission'
Requests to contact external claims agents
Fake lottery numbers and ticket information
verification_tips: You cannot win a lottery you didn't enter
Legitimate lotteries don't notify winners via email
Be extremely suspicious of unexpected large prizes
Research any lottery organization before responding

subject: Critical Windows Security Update - Install Now
body:
Important Security Notice

Microsoft has released a critical security update for Windows.

Update Information:
- Update ID: KB2024-CRITICAL
- Severity: CRITICAL
- Affects: All Windows versions
- CVE Score: 9.8/10

Install immediately:
https://windows-critical-update.com/install

This vulnerability allows remote attackers to take complete control of your computer.

Microsoft Windows Update Team

DO NOT DELAY - INSTALL NOW

phishing_indicators: Requests to download updates via email
Fake CVE scores and update IDs
ai_analysis.educational_focus: Shows operating system update scam using fake security alerts to distribute malware.
red_flags: Wrong domain: windows-update.net vs official microsoft.com
Microsoft doesn't send update notifications via email
External domain for Windows security updates
Fear tactics about system compromise
Urgent all-caps instructions to install now
verification_tips: Windows updates come through Windows Update, not email
Microsoft uses microsoft.com for official communications
Check Windows Update settings in your system
Never download Windows updates from email links
